body:
$AAPL Using empirical data for the past 16 quarters. I plotted AAPL's price movement two weeks before and one week after the earnings day. I found that there is a general linear correlation. The slope is positive when you average the past 16 quarters at a rate of +𝟬.𝟬𝟱% per day leading up to the earnings day and a +𝟬.𝟰𝟬% per day after the earnings day. 
 
Using this model, it is estimated AAPL will be at $𝟭𝟳𝟯.𝟵𝟰 on earnings day.

@nytrader60 @TheGrumpyAlbion @xiaozhm Couple things here: 
 
1.) "I don't like to be bought." ~Tony Aquila 
 
2.) If an $AAPL buyout has been the $GOEV secret plan all along (Which I HIGHLY DOUBT), warrants would also be bought out at the agreed price, less 11.5 ps. 
 
3.) The buyout price of #Canoo at this stage, road tested and production ready, to include all of its patents and IP (lock stock and barrel), I don't see Aquila settling for anything less than $500B (Half of Tesla, 1/6th Apple). 
 
4.) Rough math puts that buyout SP around 1700 per share. 
 
5.) Many will call me a loony for talking such ridiculous numbers on a company with a MC under 3B ATM, but I can assure you, the "Media Announced" number would be around there.
